key_risks: Geopolitical and legal risks due to U.S. criminal investigation and export restrictions
Supply chain vulnerabilities from reliance on global suppliers
Intense competition from industry leaders like ASML, Lam Research, and Tokyo Electron
controversies: Under U.S. criminal investigation for allegedly evading export restrictions to China
Ongoing U.S.-China trade tensions impacting market access
environmental_issues: Resource-intensive semiconductor manufacturing process with high energy consumption and chemical waste
social_issues: Challenges in ensuring ethical labor practices and responsible sourcing across global supply chain
governance_issues: Potential governance risks from legal investigations and compliance challenges

sources.title: US government extends investigation into Applied Materials for alleged ...
sources.snippet: In 2020, the US Commerce Department added SMIC - China's largest contract chipmaker - to its sanctions list, requiring companies to seek individual export licenses to sell equipment to the company. sources.title: Applied Materials Faces U.S. Probe Over SMIC Export Violations
sources.snippet: The largest U.S. semiconductor equipment maker, Applied Materials, is currently the subject of a U.S. criminal investigation regarding potential violations of export restrictions concerning China's leading chipmaker, SMIC.
